page.title: 01The Landscape
page.content: THIS IS A MAINLY RURAL AREA SITUATED IN THE FOOTHILLS OF THE RADNOR FOREST AT THE ENTRANCE TO THE RADNOR VALLEY. THE SMATCHER HILL,(1396 feet) DOMINATES THE AREA AND LOOKS DOWN ON THE VILLAGE OF NEW RADNOR, WHICH IS THE CENTRE OF THE COMMUNITY.MANY SMALL FARMS ARE SCATTERED AROUND THE HILLS AND IN THE VALLEY. THE MAIN A44 ABERYSTWYTH TO WORCESTER ROAD RUNS THROUGH THE VILLAGE , BUT RECENTLY A NEW BY PASS WAS BUILT AROUND THE PERIMETER BRINGING PEACE TO A ONCE VERY BUSY THOROUGHFARE. A GOODS SHED IS THE ONLY EVIDENCE REMAINING OF THE BRITISH RAILWAY BRANCH LINE THAT ONCE RAN REGULARLY FROM KINGTON TO NEW RADNOR.
